name: KiXtart Tokenized Script File
summary: Learn about .KX files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Since KIX files are saved in a text format that can be viewed and edited by a text editor, the KX file provides a higher level of security. KX tokenized scripts can be run from the KiXtart command line and by using the CALL command, unless the KX file is password protected.

description: A KX file is a tokenized version of the .KIX file written in the KiXtart scripting language. It is a script that is smaller and can be processed faster than KIX scripts. The file is encrypted and contains a signature for protection from any accidental changes in the script.
